title: Blocking Access to Harmful Content Will Not Protect Children Online, No Matter How Many Times UK Politicians Say So
summary: UK politicians have frequently argued that restricting access to harmful online content is essential for protecting children; however, this article challenges that notion by asserting that solely blocking content is insufficient for safeguarding young internet users. title: When Good Accounts Go Bad: Exploiting Delegated Managed Service Accounts in Active Directory
summary: The article "When Good Accounts Go Bad: Exploiting Delegated Managed Service Accounts in Active Directory" discusses the security risks associated with delegated managed service accounts (gMSAs) in Active Directory environments. title: The Record: Jury ‘sends a message’ on app privacy in ruling against Meta
summary: A jury has delivered a significant verdict against Meta, the parent company of Facebook, emphasizing the importance of user privacy in the realm of mobile applications. The decision underscores growing concerns over how tech giants handle personal data and signals a broader demand for accountability in the digital age. This landmark ruling could serve as a precedent for future cases and highlights the escalating pressure on companies to prioritize user privacy and transparency regarding their data practices.
